text: David Azéma (born 22 November 1960)Companies House is a French businessman, and a former chairman and chief executive of Eurostar from 1999 to 2002; he worked with the French government's Agence des participations de l'État, and is chairman of Global Infrastructure Group at Bank of America.Le Monde 2014 ==Early life== He was born and brought up in Paris. His parents were both university professors. In his teenage years he thought about becoming a film director. He attended Lycée Henri-IV in Paris. From the University of Paris he gained a degree in law. He later studied Politics at Sciences Po. He then trained at the École nationale d'administration (ENA) in Strasbourg, leaving in 1987. ==Career== In 1993 he joined the economics department of SNCF. ===Eurostar=== He joined Eurostar in March 1999. He became chairman of Eurostar in October 1999, aged 38. The company had been restructured. Eurostar had 31 trains, each costing £24m; they could run on three different electrical power systems and four different signalling systems. At the time, Eurostar had 65% of the London-Paris market. He resigned from Eurostar Group on 12 June 2002. He was replaced on 4 July 2002 by the current Eurostar chairman Guillaume Pepy, who in 2008 became Chief Exceutive of SNCF. ==References== ==External links== * Biography Category:1960 births Category:Living people Category:People from Neuilly-sur-Seine Category:Lycée Henri-IV alumni Category:Sciences Po alumni Category:École nationale d'administration alumni Category:French businesspeople Category:French rail transport chief executives Category:Judges of the Cour des comptes (France)
title: David Azéma
